Class RoverDropDownReceiver

  • java.lang.Object

        • com.atakmap.android.radiolibrary.RoverDropDownReceiver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.SharedPreferences.OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener, android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.view.View.OnLongClickListener, DropDown.OnStateListener, RoverInterface.RadioListener

extends DropDownReceiver
implements android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.view.View.OnLongClickListener, RoverInterface.RadioListener, DropDown.OnStateListener, android.content.SharedPreferences.OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  RoverDropDownReceiver.Frequency  
      class  RoverDropDownReceiver.NetworkCheckerRunnable
      Very simple thread that polls every 5 seconds to see if the network is down, and if it is down attempts to bring it back up.

      • onMcoStatus

        public void onMcoStatus​(int status)
        Description copied from interface: RoverInterface.RadioListener
        Outgoing sending status for the Radio. This is only useful for describing the outgoing data from the end user device to the Rover. OK=1, TIMEOUT=2, ERROR=3, STOPPED=4
        Specified by:
        onMcoStatus in interface RoverInterface.RadioListener

      • onMciStatus

        public void onMciStatus​(int status)
        Description copied from interface: RoverInterface.RadioListener
        Incoming status for the Radio. Monitors the receipt of incoming packets and when there are consecutive losses where packets are expected, then the status moves from TIMEOUT to ERROR. OK=1, TIMEOUT=2, ERROR=3, STOPPED=4
        Specified by:
        onMciStatus in interface RoverInterface.RadioListener

      • onReceiverStatus

        public void onReceiverStatus​(RoverInterface.Receiver r)
        Description copied from interface: RoverInterface.RadioListener
        Provides the heartbeat status for the device based on the solicited response (automatically done with a static period after monitoring has been started.
        Specified by:
        onReceiverStatus in interface RoverInterface.RadioListener

      • watchVideo

        public void watchVideo​(boolean external)
        Broadcasts the video intent to watch a video.
        Parameters:

      • startNetworkChecking

        public void startNetworkChecking​(java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String address,
                                 java.lang.String subnet,
                                 java.lang.String gateway,
                                 int polling)
        For the record, internal management of the first network interface by ATAK is not a great idea. Having an external application monitor the network makes a lot more sense. Having said this, people have become comfortable with the network configuration just happening within ATAK. This allows the network to be rekicked if it happens to go down.

      • stopNetworkChecking

        public void stopNetworkChecking()

        public static boolean setFrequency​(int freqMhz)

      • setModuleChannel

        public static boolean setModuleChannel​(java.lang.String mt,
                                       int channel)
        DDL support for Module/Channel (Module can be the string "M1, "M2", "M3", or "M4")

      • getLastStatus

        public static RoverInterface.Receiver getLastStatus()
        Last Status received from the rover. If the rover is no longer monitoring or no status has been received, null is returned.

      • watch

        public static boolean watch()
        Allows for the video to be watched, if the radio is already under the control of ATAK or the network monitor.
